alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 31 at 4:11AM MDT until May 31 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT TUESDAY FROM 1 PM MDT TO 7 PM MDT FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Winds turn southerly and will remain strong enough to combine with high Haines, and single- digit humidity through the northeast highlands to produce another round of critical fire weather this afternoon. A strong wind shift to the northeast and influx of cooler and more moist air will arrive once critical fire weather ends Tuesday evening. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 7 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast Highlands 1 PM to 7 PM this afternoon through this evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...South winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph this afternoon. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 5 to 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
